meta.videoTitle: How to Prevent & Treat Colds & Flu

title_en: Spreading a Cold; Symptoms & Contagious Myths
title_zh: 传播感冒：症状和传染的神话

paragraphList.text_en: The common cold, caused by various types of cold viruses known as serotypes, can present a range of symptoms. Different individuals may experience varying degrees of severity in symptoms, such as a runny nose, stuffy head, and even fever. It is important to note that individuals typically develop symptoms one to two days after being exposed to the cold virus. However, not everyone who is exposed will necessarily become infected. The immune system plays a crucial role in fighting off the virus, which means that exposure does not equate to catching a cold. Strengthening the immune system through scientifically supported methods can significantly decrease the likelihood of falling ill even when encountering a new serotype of the cold virus.
paragraphList.text_zh: 感冒是由众所周知的多种冷病毒引起的，并可能呈现一系列症状。不同个体可能会经历不同程度严重的症状，如流鼻涕、头部不适，甚至发烧。值得注意的是，人们通常在接触感冒病毒后的一到两天内出现症状。然而，并非每个接触病毒的人都一定会被感染。免疫系统在对抗病毒中起着至关重要的作用，这意味着接触并非意味着一定感冒。通过科学支持的方法增强免疫系统可以显著减少患病的可能性，即使遇到新的感冒病毒亚型时也是如此。

paragraphList.text_en: When it comes to contagion, individuals are most infectious to others when they are experiencing the peak of their symptoms, including coughing, sneezing, and general discomfort. However, it is also possible to spread the virus even as symptoms begin to alleviate. Studies indicate that around five to six days after reaching the peak of symptoms, the contagious phase typically diminishes. Nonetheless, if symptoms persist, particularly sneezing and coughing, or if there is a worsening of symptoms, it is essential to continue taking precautions as the risk of spreading the virus remains.
paragraphList.text_zh: 在传染病方面，个体在经历症状高峰期时对他人的传染性最强，包括咳嗽、打喷嚏和一般的不适。然而，即使症状开始缓解，也有可能传播病毒。研究表明在症状高峰后大约五到六天，传染阶段通常会减弱。然而，如果症状持续，特别是打喷嚏和咳嗽，或者症状恶化，继续采取预防措施是必要的，因为传播病毒的风险仍然存在。

paragraphList.text_en: Dispelling the myth that individuals are no longer contagious after a few days of having a cold is crucial. Contrary to popular belief, even when symptoms start to improve, one can still be contagious if signs of the cold persist. Therefore, it is imperative for those experiencing a cold to stay at home and minimize contact with others whenever possible, especially in shared environments like workplaces, gyms, and households. This proactive approach not only aids in preventing the spread of the virus but also helps in reducing the economic, mental, and physical burdens associated with cold infections.
paragraphList.text_zh: 消除一个误解，即感冒几天后个人不再具有传染性是非常重要的。与普遍看法相反，即使症状开始好转，如果感冒的迹象仍然存在，一个人仍然可能具有传染性。因此，对于那些感冒的人来说，尽可能留在家中并减少与他人的接触是至关重要的，特别是在共享环境中，如工作场所、健身房和家庭。这种积极的做法不仅有助于预防病毒的传播，还有助于减少感冒感染所带来的经济、心理和生理负担。

paragraphList.text_en: By promoting awareness of the contagious nature of cold viruses and encouraging responsible behavior when symptomatic, individuals can contribute to creating healthier environments and mitigating the risks associated with the common cold. Educating the public about the importance of staying home when sick, regardless of the duration of the illness, can lead to a significant reduction in the transmission of cold viruses and ultimately benefit the overall well-being of communities.
paragraphList.text_zh: 通过提高对感冒病毒传染性质的认识，鼓励在出现症状时采取负责任的行为，个人可以为创造更健康的环境和减轻普通感冒所带来的风险做出贡献。教育公众在生病时无论病程多长都要待在家里的重要性将会显著减少感冒病毒的传播，最终有益于社区的整体福祉。
